optimal_care.description: Clean spills immediately after surfaces cool
Regularly wash grates in hot soapy water and rinse clean
Keep burner ports and ignition electrodes clean and dry
Ensure burner caps are properly centered and flat after cleaning
Clean stainless steel surfaces with approved cleaner in grain direction
Check burners regularly for normal flame patterns
Keep vents unobstructed for proper ventilation

safety.description: Never store flammable materials near cooktop
If gas smell detected: Don't light appliances, touch electrical switches, or use phones in building
Keep flames contained under cookware bottoms
Don't leave burners unattended on medium/high heat
Know gas shutoff valve location and operation

cleaning.description: Use hot soapy water for general cleaning
Use manufacturer approved stainless steel cleanser
Use soft cloths and non-abrasive plastic scrubbing pads
Avoid steel wool, abrasive cleaners, and caustic chemicals

maintenance.description: All service must be performed by qualified technicians
Contact service if burners show irregular flames or malfunction
